referer.description:
If provided, it will take preference over the referer header value set by
{@link Page.setExtraHTTPHeaderspage.setExtraHTTPHeaders()}.

referrerPolicy.description:
If provided, it will take preference over the referer-policy header value
set by {@link Page.setExtraHTTPHeaderspage.setExtraHTTPHeaders()}.

timeout.description:
Maximum wait time in milliseconds. Pass 0 to disable the timeout.

The default value can be changed by using the
{@link Page.setDefaultTimeout} or {@link Page.setDefaultNavigationTimeout}
methods.

waitUntil.description:
When to consider waiting succeeds. Given an array of event strings, waiting
is considered to be successful after all events have been fired.

signal.description: A signal object that allows you to cancel the call.

expires.description:
Cookie expiration date as the number of seconds since the UNIX epoch. Set to `-1` for
session cookies

session.description: True in case of session cookie.

priority.description: Cookie Priority. Supported only in Chrome.

sameParty.description: True if cookie is SameParty. Supported only in Chrome.

sourceScheme.description: Cookie source scheme type. Supported only in Chrome.

partitionKey.description:
Cookie partition key. In Chrome, it is the top-level site the
partitioned cookie is available in. In Firefox, it matches the
source origin
(https://w3c.github.io/webdriver-bidi/#type-storage-PartitionKey).

partitionKeyOpaque.description: True if cookie partition key is opaque. Supported only in Chrome.

CookieSourceScheme.description:
Represents the source scheme of the origin that originally set the cookie. A value of
"Unset" allows protocol clients to emulate legacy cookie scope for the scheme.
This is a temporary ability and it will be removed in the future.

url.description: URL of the script to be added.

path.description: Path to a JavaScript file to be injected into the frame.

content.description: JavaScript to be injected into the frame.

type.description: Sets the `type` of the script. Use `module` in order to load an ES2015 module.

url.description: the URL of the CSS file to be added.

path.description: The path to a CSS file to be injected into the frame.

content.description: Raw CSS content to be injected into the frame.

url.description:
The request-URI to associate with the setting of the cookie. This value can affect
the default domain, path, and source scheme values of the created cookie.

expires.description: Cookie expiration date, session cookie if not set

priority.description: Cookie Priority. Supported only in Chrome.

sameParty.description: True if cookie is SameParty. Supported only in Chrome.

sourceScheme.description: Cookie source scheme type. Supported only in Chrome.

partitionKey.description:
Cookie partition key. In Chrome, it matches the top-level site the
partitioned cookie is available in. In Firefox, it matches the
source origin
(https://w3c.github.io/webdriver-bidi/#type-storage-PartitionKey).

PDFOptions.description: Valid options to configure PDF generation via {@link Page.pdf}.

scale.description: Scales the rendering of the web page. Amount must be between `0.1` and `2`.

displayHeaderFooter.description: Whether to show the header and footer.

headerTemplate.description:
HTML template for the print header. Should be valid HTML with the following
classes used to inject values into them:

- `date` formatted print date

- `title` document title

- `url` document location

- `pageNumber` current page number

- `totalPages` total pages in the document

footerTemplate.description:
HTML template for the print footer. Has the same constraints and support
for special classes as {@link PDFOptions.headerTemplate}.

printBackground.description: Set to `true` to print background graphics.

landscape.description: Whether to print in landscape orientation.

width.description: Sets the width of paper. You can pass in a number or a string with a unit.

height.description: Sets the height of paper. You can pass in a number or a string with a unit.

preferCSSPageSize.description:
Give any CSS `@page` size declared in the page priority over what is
declared in the `width` or `height` or `format` option.

path.description: The path to save the file to.

omitBackground.description: Hides default white background and allows generating pdfs with transparency.

timeout.description:
Timeout in milliseconds. Pass `0` to disable timeout.

The default value can be changed by using {@link Page.setDefaultTimeout}

waitForFonts.description:
If true, waits for `document.fonts.ready` to resolve. This might require
activating the page using {@link Page.bringToFront} if the page is in the
background.

PaperFormat.description: All the valid paper format types when printing a PDF.

headers.description: Optional response headers. All values are converted to strings.

width.description: The page width in CSS pixels.

height.description: The page height in CSS pixels.

deviceScaleFactor.description:
Specify device scale factor.
See {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window/devicePixelRatio devicePixelRatio} for more info.

isMobile.description: Whether the `meta viewport` tag is taken into account.

isLandscape.description: Specifies if the viewport is in landscape mode.

hasTouch.description: Specify if the viewport supports touch events.

quality.description: Quality of the image, between 0-100. Not applicable to `png` images.

fromSurface.description: Capture the screenshot from the surface, rather than the view.

fullPage.description: When `true`, takes a screenshot of the full page.

omitBackground.description: Hides default white background and allows capturing screenshots with transparency.

path.description:
The file path to save the image to. The screenshot type will be inferred
from file extension. If path is a relative path, then it is resolved
relative to current working directory. If no path is provided, the image
won't be saved to the disk.

clip.description: Specifies the region of the page/element to clip.

captureBeyondViewport.description: Capture the screenshot beyond the viewport.

width.description: the width of the element in pixels.

height.description: the height of the element in pixels.

description.description: The description of the target. Generally the page's title.

devtoolsFrontendUrl.description: The fully-qualified URL of the Devtools inspector app.

id.description: A Unique Id for the underlying target.

title.description: The title of the target. For pages this is the page's title.

type.description: The type of target, generally "page" or "background_page".

url.description: The current URL the target is consuming or visiting.

webSocketDebuggerUrl.description:
The target or page's WebSocket Debugger URL. Primarily used for legacy
libraries to connect and inspect or remote automate this target.

info.title: Browserless

get.description: Launch and connect to Chromium with a library like puppeteer or others that work over chrome-devtools-protocol.

schema.description:
Whether or nor to load ad-blocking extensions for the session.
This currently uses uBlock Origin and may cause certain sites
to not load properly.

Launch options, which can be either an object
of puppeteer.launch options or playwright.launchServer
options, depending on the API. Must be either JSON
object, or a base64-encoded JSON object.

Override the system-level timeout for this request.
Accepts a value in milliseconds.
The authorization token

400.description: The request contains errors or didn't properly encode content.

401.description: The request is missing, or contains bad, authorization credentials.

408.description: The request took has taken too long to process.

429.description: Too many requests are currently being processed.

500.description: An internal error occurred when handling the request.

get.description: Reconnect to an existing Chromium or Chrome session with a library like puppeteer or others that work over chrome-devtools-protocol.

schema.description:
Whether or nor to load ad-blocking extensions for the session.
This currently uses uBlock Origin and may cause certain sites
to not load properly.

Launch options, which can be either an object
of puppeteer.launch options or playwright.launchServer
options, depending on the API. Must be either JSON
object, or a base64-encoded JSON object.

Override the system-level timeout for this request.
Accepts a value in milliseconds.
The authorization token

400.description: The request contains errors or didn't properly encode content.

401.description: The request is missing, or contains bad, authorization credentials.

408.description: The request took has taken too long to process.

429.description: Too many requests are currently being processed.

500.description: An internal error occurred when handling the request.

post.description:
> This API is only available for Enterprise and Cloud-unit plans. [Contact us for more information here.](https://www.browserless.io/contact/), or [sign-up here](https://www.browserless.io/pricing/).

Unblocks the provided URL from being blocked due to bot detection.
Returns a payload of Cookies, HTML, a base64 encoded screenshot,
and a "browserWSEndpoint" to allow connecting to the browser when
specified in the JSON Payload. Only supports CDP or Puppeteer
like libraries when connecting to the "browserWSEndpoint".

schema.description:
Whether or nor to load ad-blocking extensions for the session.
This currently uses uBlock Origin and may cause certain sites
to not load properly.

Launch options, which can be either an object
of puppeteer.launch options or playwright.launchServer
options, depending on the API. Must be either JSON
object, or a base64-encoded JSON object.

Override the system-level timeout for this request.
Accepts a value in milliseconds.
The authorization token

bestAttempt.description:
When bestAttempt is set to true, browserless attempt to proceed
when "awaited" events fail or timeout. This includes things like
goto, waitForSelector, and more.

url.description: The URL of the site you want to unblock.

browserWSEndpoint.description:
Whether or not to keep the underlying browser alive and around for
future reconnects. Defaults to false.

cookies.description: Whether or not to to return cookies for the site, defaults to true.

content.description: Whether or not to to return content for the site, defaults to true.

screenshot.description: Whether or not to to return a full-page screenshot for the site, defaults to true.

ttl.description:
When the browserWSEndpoint is requested this tells
browserless how long to keep this browser alive for
re-connection until shutting it down completely.
Maximum of 30000 for 30 seconds (30,000ms).

gotoOptions.description: An optional goto parameter object for considering when the page is done loading.

fn.description: The function, or statement, to be evaluated in browser context

polling.description:
An interval at which the pageFunction is executed, defaults to raf.
If polling is a number, then it is treated as an interval in milliseconds
at which the function would be executed. If polling is a string,
then it can be one of the following values: "raf" or "mutation"

timeout.description:
Maximum time to wait for in milliseconds. Defaults to 30000 (30 seconds).
Pass 0 to disable timeout.

cookies.description:
A list of cookies which can be used for new connections or for usage elsewhere.
Value is "null" when the request body specifies cookies: false.

content.description:
The HTML content of the page once it is passed bot detection.
Value is "null" when the request body specifies cookies: false.

browserWSEndpoint.description:
The browserWSEndpoint of the response when the POST body contains a
browserWSEndpoint: true property

ttl.description:
The time the browser will remain alive until it is shutdown. Zero
when browserWSEndpoint: false is set in the request payload. The limit
is 30000 or 30 seconds, which is the maximum allowed time.

screenshot.description: A base64 encoded JPEG of the of the final site page.

expires.description:
Cookie expiration date as the number of seconds since the UNIX epoch. Set to `-1` for
session cookies

session.description: True in case of session cookie.

priority.description: Cookie Priority. Supported only in Chrome.

sameParty.description: True if cookie is SameParty. Supported only in Chrome.

sourceScheme.description: Cookie source scheme type. Supported only in Chrome.

partitionKey.description:
Cookie partition key. In Chrome, it is the top-level site the
partitioned cookie is available in. In Firefox, it matches the
source origin
(https://w3c.github.io/webdriver-bidi/#type-storage-PartitionKey).

partitionKeyOpaque.description: True if cookie partition key is opaque. Supported only in Chrome.

CookieSourceScheme.description:
Represents the source scheme of the origin that originally set the cookie. A value of
"Unset" allows protocol clients to emulate legacy cookie scope for the scheme.
This is a temporary ability and it will be removed in the future.

400.description: The request contains errors or didn't properly encode content.

401.description: The request is missing, or contains bad, authorization credentials.

408.description: The request took has taken too long to process.

429.description: Too many requests are currently being processed.

500.description: An internal error occurred when handling the request.

post.description:
> This API is only available for Enterprise and Cloud-unit plans. [Contact us for more information here.](https://www.browserless.io/contact/), or [sign-up here](https://www.browserless.io/pricing/).

Unblocks the provided URL from being blocked due to bot detection.
Returns a payload of Cookies, HTML, a base64 encoded screenshot,
and a "browserWSEndpoint" to allow connecting to the browser when
specified in the JSON Payload. Only supports CDP or Puppeteer
like libraries when connecting to the "browserWSEndpoint".

session.description: True in case of session cookie.

priority.description: Cookie Priority. Supported only in Chrome.

sameParty.description: True if cookie is SameParty. Supported only in Chrome.

sourceScheme.description: Cookie source scheme type. Supported only in Chrome.

partitionKey.description:
Cookie partition key. In Chrome, it is the top-level site the

source origin
(https://w3c.github.io/webdriver-bidi/#type-storage-PartitionKey).

CookieSourceScheme.description:
Represents the source scheme of the origin that originally set the cookie. A value of
"Unset" allows protocol clients to emulate legacy cookie scope for the scheme.
This is a temporary ability and it will be removed in the future.

400.description: The request contains errors or didn't properly encode content.

401.description: The request is missing, or contains bad, authorization credentials.

408.description: The request took has taken too long to process.

429.description: Too many requests are currently being processed.

500.description: An internal error occurred when handling the request.

post.description:
A JSON-based API for getting a PDF binary from either a supplied
"url" or "html" payload in your request. Many options exist for
injecting cookies, request interceptors, user-agents and waiting for
selectors, timers and more.

schema.description:
Whether or nor to load ad-blocking extensions for the session.
This currently uses uBlock Origin and may cause certain sites
to not load properly.

Launch options, which can be either an object
of puppeteer.launch options or playwright.launchServer
options, depending on the API. Must be either JSON
object, or a base64-encoded JSON object.

Override the system-level timeout for this request.
Accepts a value in milliseconds.
The authorization token

bestAttempt.description:
When bestAttempt is set to true, browserless attempt to proceed
when "awaited" events fail or timeout. This includes things like
goto, waitForSelector, and more.

items.description:
An array of patterns (using `req.url().match(r.pattern)` to match) and their
corresponding responses to use in order to fulfill those requests.

pattern.description:
An array of patterns (using `req.url().match(r.pattern)` to match) and their
corresponding responses to use in order to fulfill those requests.

fn.description: The function, or statement, to be evaluated in browser context

polling.description:
An interval at which the pageFunction is executed, defaults to raf.
If polling is a number, then it is treated as an interval in milliseconds
at which the function would be executed. If polling is a string,
then it can be one of the following values: "raf" or "mutation"

timeout.description:
Maximum time to wait for in milliseconds. Defaults to 30000 (30 seconds).
Pass 0 to disable timeout.

schema.description: Responds with an application/pdf content-type and a binary PDF

200.description: Responds with an application/pdf content-type and a binary PDF

400.description: The request contains errors or didn't properly encode content.

401.description: The request is missing, or contains bad, authorization credentials.

408.description: The request took has taken too long to process.

429.description: Too many requests are currently being processed.

500.description: An internal error occurred when handling the request.

post.description:
A JSON-based API for getting a screenshot binary from either a supplied
"url" or "html" payload in your request. Many options exist including
cookies, user-agents, setting timers and network mocks.

schema.description:
Whether or nor to load ad-blocking extensions for the session.
This currently uses uBlock Origin and may cause certain sites
to not load properly.

Launch options, which can be either an object
of puppeteer.launch options or playwright.launchServer
options, depending on the API. Must be either JSON
object, or a base64-encoded JSON object.

Override the system-level timeout for this request.
Accepts a value in milliseconds.
The authorization token

bestAttempt.description:
When bestAttempt is set to true, browserless attempt to proceed
when "awaited" events fail or timeout. This includes things like
goto, waitForSelector, and more.

items.description:
An array of patterns (using `req.url().match(r.pattern)` to match) and their
corresponding responses to use in order to fulfill those requests.

pattern.description:
An array of patterns (using `req.url().match(r.pattern)` to match) and their
corresponding responses to use in order to fulfill those requests.

fn.description: The function, or statement, to be evaluated in browser context

polling.description:
An interval at which the pageFunction is executed, defaults to raf.
If polling is a number, then it is treated as an interval in milliseconds
at which the function would be executed. If polling is a string,
then it can be one of the following values: "raf" or "mutation"

timeout.description:
Maximum time to wait for in milliseconds. Defaults to 30000 (30 seconds).
Pass 0 to disable timeout.

200.description:
Response can either be a text/plain base64 encoded body
or a binary stream with png/jpeg as a content-type

400.description: The request contains errors or didn't properly encode content.

401.description: The request is missing, or contains bad, authorization credentials.

408.description: The request took has taken too long to process.

429.description: Too many requests are currently being processed.

500.description: An internal error occurred when handling the request.

> This API is only available for Enterprise and Cloud-unit plans. [Contact us for more information here.](https://www.browserless.io/contact/), or [sign-up here](https://www.browserless.io/pricing/).

Launch and connect to Stealthy Chromium with a library like puppeteer or others that work over chrome-devtools-protocol for scraping in a more stealth-like fashion.

schema.description:
Whether or nor to load ad-blocking extensions for the session.
This currently uses uBlock Origin and may cause certain sites
to not load properly.

Launch options, which can be either an object
of puppeteer.launch options or playwright.launchServer
options, depending on the API. Must be either JSON
object, or a base64-encoded JSON object.

Override the system-level timeout for this request.
Accepts a value in milliseconds.
The authorization token

Launch and connect to Stealthy Chromium with a library like puppeteer or others that work over chrome-devtools-protocol for scraping in a more stealth-like fashion.

This currently uses uBlock Origin and may cause certain sites

options, depending on the API. Must be either JSON
object, or a base64-encoded JSON object.

Override the system-level timeout for this request.

The authorization token

408.description: The request took has taken too long to process.

post.description: A JSON-based API. Given a "url" or "html" field, runs and returns HTML content after the page has loaded and JavaScript has parsed.

schema.description:
Whether or nor to load ad-blocking extensions for the session.
This currently uses uBlock Origin and may cause certain sites
to not load properly.

Override the system-level timeout for this request.
Accepts a value in milliseconds.
The authorization token

bestAttempt.description:
When bestAttempt is set to true, browserless attempt to proceed
when "awaited" events fail or timeout. This includes things like
goto, waitForSelector, and more.

items.description:
An array of patterns (using `req.url().match(r.pattern)` to match) and their
corresponding responses to use in order to fulfill those requests.

pattern.description:
An array of patterns (using `req.url().match(r.pattern)` to match) and their
corresponding responses to use in order to fulfill those requests.

setJavaScriptEnabled.description: Whether or not to allow JavaScript to run on the page.

fn.description: The function, or statement, to be evaluated in browser context

polling.description:
An interval at which the pageFunction is executed, defaults to raf.
If polling is a number, then it is treated as an interval in milliseconds
at which the function would be executed. If polling is a string,
then it can be one of the following values: "raf" or "mutation"

timeout.description:
Maximum time to wait for in milliseconds. Defaults to 30000 (30 seconds).
Pass 0 to disable timeout.

schema.description:
An HTML payload of the website or HTML after JavaScript
parsing and execution.

200.description:
An HTML payload of the website or HTML after JavaScript
parsing and execution.

400.description: The request contains errors or didn't properly encode content.

401.description: The request is missing, or contains bad, authorization credentials.

408.description: The request took has taken too long to process.

429.description: Too many requests are currently being processed.

500.description: An internal error occurred when handling the request.

post.description:
A JSON or JavaScript content-type API for returning files Chrome has downloaded during
the execution of puppeteer code, which is ran inside context of the browser.
Browserless sets up a blank page, a fresh download directory, injects your puppeteer code, and then executes it.
You can load external libraries via the "import" syntax, and import ESM-style modules
that are written for execution inside of the browser. Once your script is finished, any
downloaded files from Chromium are returned back with the appropriate content-type header.

schema.description:
Whether or nor to load ad-blocking extensions for the session.
This currently uses uBlock Origin and may cause certain sites
to not load properly.

Launch options, which can be either an object
of puppeteer.launch options or playwright.launchServer
options, depending on the API. Must be either JSON
object, or a base64-encoded JSON object.

Override the system-level timeout for this request.
Accepts a value in milliseconds.
The authorization token

Responses are determined by the returned value of the downloads
themselves, so there isn't a static response type for this API.

200.description:
Responses are determined by the returned value of the downloads
themselves, so there isn't a static response type for this API.

400.description: The request contains errors or didn't properly encode content.

401.description: The request is missing, or contains bad, authorization credentials.

408.description: The request took has taken too long to process.

429.description: Too many requests are currently being processed.

500.description: An internal error occurred when handling the request.

post.description:
A JSON or JavaScript content-type API for running puppeteer code in the browser's context.
Browserless sets up a blank page, injects your puppeteer code, and runs it.
You can optionally load external libraries via the "import" module that are meant for browser usage.
Values returned from the function are checked and an appropriate content-type and response is sent back
to your HTTP call.

schema.description:
Whether or nor to load ad-blocking extensions for the session.
This currently uses uBlock Origin and may cause certain sites
to not load properly.

Launch options, which can be either an object
of puppeteer.launch options or playwright.launchServer
options, depending on the API. Must be either JSON
object, or a base64-encoded JSON object.

Override the system-level timeout for this request.
Accepts a value in milliseconds.
The authorization token

Responses are determined by the returned value of the function
itself. Binary responses (PDF's, screenshots) are returned back
as binary data, and primitive JavaScript values are returned back
by type (HTML data is "text/html", Objects are "application/json")

200.description:
Responses are determined by the returned value of the function
itself. Binary responses (PDF's, screenshots) are returned back
as binary data, and primitive JavaScript values are returned back
by type (HTML data is "text/html", Objects are "application/json")

400.description: The request contains errors or didn't properly encode content.

401.description: The request is missing, or contains bad, authorization credentials.

408.description: The request took has taken too long to process.

429.description: Too many requests are currently being processed.

500.description: An internal error occurred when handling the request.

get.description:
Returns a JSON payload that acts as a pass-through to the DevTools /json/list HTTP API in Chromium and Chrome.
Browserless crafts this payload so that remote clients can connect to the underlying "webSocketDebuggerUrl"
properly, excluding any API tokens in that URL. If under authentication be sure to include your authorization.

description.description: The description of the target. Generally the page's title.

devtoolsFrontendUrl.description: The fully-qualified URL of the Devtools inspector app.

id.description: A Unique Id for the underlying target.

title.description: The title of the target. For pages this is the page's title.

type.description: The type of target, generally "page" or "background_page".

url.description: The current URL the target is consuming or visiting.

webSocketDebuggerUrl.description:
The target or page's WebSocket Debugger URL. Primarily used for legacy
libraries to connect and inspect or remote automate this target.

400.description: The request contains errors or didn't properly encode content.

401.description: The request is missing, or contains bad, authorization credentials.

408.description: The request took has taken too long to process.

429.description: Too many requests are currently being processed.

500.description: An internal error occurred when handling the request.

put.description:
Returns a JSON payload that acts as a pass-through to the DevTools /json/new HTTP API in Chromium.
Browserless mocks this payload so that remote clients can connect to the underlying "webSocketDebuggerUrl"
which will cause Browserless to start the browser and proxy that request into a blank page.

webSocketDebuggerUrl.description:

libraries to connect and inspect or remote automate this target.

post.description:
A JSON-based API for getting a PDF binary from either a supplied
"url" or "html" payload in your request. Many options exist for
injecting cookies, request interceptors, user-agents and waiting for
selectors, timers and more.

schema.description:
Whether or nor to load ad-blocking extensions for the session.
This currently uses uBlock Origin and may cause certain sites
to not load properly.

Launch options, which can be either an object
of puppeteer.launch options or playwright.launchServer
options, depending on the API. Must be either JSON
object, or a base64-encoded JSON object.

Override the system-level timeout for this request.
Accepts a value in milliseconds.
The authorization token

bestAttempt.description:
When bestAttempt is set to true, browserless attempt to proceed
when "awaited" events fail or timeout. This includes things like
goto, waitForSelector, and more.

items.description:
An array of patterns (using `req.url().match(r.pattern)` to match) and their
corresponding responses to use in order to fulfill those requests.

pattern.description:
An array of patterns (using `req.url().match(r.pattern)` to match) and their
corresponding responses to use in order to fulfill those requests.

fn.description: The function, or statement, to be evaluated in browser context

polling.description:
An interval at which the pageFunction is executed, defaults to raf.
If polling is a number, then it is treated as an interval in milliseconds
at which the function would be executed. If polling is a string,
then it can be one of the following values: "raf" or "mutation"

timeout.description:
Maximum time to wait for in milliseconds. Defaults to 30000 (30 seconds).
Pass 0 to disable timeout.

schema.description: Responds with an application/pdf content-type and a binary PDF

200.description: Responds with an application/pdf content-type and a binary PDF

400.description: The request contains errors or didn't properly encode content.

401.description: The request is missing, or contains bad, authorization credentials.

408.description: The request took has taken too long to process.

429.description: Too many requests are currently being processed.

500.description: An internal error occurred when handling the request.

post.description: Run lighthouse performance audits with a supplied "url" in your JSON payload.

schema.description:
Whether or nor to load ad-blocking extensions for the session.
This currently uses uBlock Origin and may cause certain sites
to not load properly.

Launch options, which can be either an object
of puppeteer.launch options or playwright.launchServer
options, depending on the API. Must be either JSON
object, or a base64-encoded JSON object.

Override the system-level timeout for this request.
Accepts a value in milliseconds.
The authorization token

The response of the lighthouse stats. Response objects are
determined by the type of budgets and config in the POST
JSON body

200.description:
The response of the lighthouse stats. Response objects are
determined by the type of budgets and config in the POST
JSON body

400.description: The request contains errors or didn't properly encode content.

401.description: The request is missing, or contains bad, authorization credentials.

408.description: The request took has taken too long to process.

429.description: Too many requests are currently being processed.

500.description: An internal error occurred when handling the request.

post.description:
A JSON-based API that returns text, html, and meta-data from a given list of selectors.
Debugging information is available by sending in the appropriate flags in the "debugOpts"
property. Responds with an array of JSON objects.

schema.description:
Whether or nor to load ad-blocking extensions for the session.
This currently uses uBlock Origin and may cause certain sites
to not load properly.

Override the system-level timeout for this request.
Accepts a value in milliseconds.
The authorization token

bestAttempt.description:
When bestAttempt is set to true, browserless attempt to proceed
when "awaited" events fail or timeout. This includes things like
goto, waitForSelector, and more.

items.description:
An array of patterns (using `req.url().match(r.pattern)` to match) and their
corresponding responses to use in order to fulfill those requests.

pattern.description:
An array of patterns (using `req.url().match(r.pattern)` to match) and their
corresponding responses to use in order to fulfill those requests.

fn.description: The function, or statement, to be evaluated in browser context

polling.description:
An interval at which the pageFunction is executed, defaults to raf.
If polling is a number, then it is treated as an interval in milliseconds
at which the function would be executed. If polling is a string,
then it can be one of the following values: "raf" or "mutation"

timeout.description:
Maximum time to wait for in milliseconds. Defaults to 30000 (30 seconds).
Pass 0 to disable timeout.

schema.description: The JSON response body

attributes.description: A list of HTML attributes of the element

name.description: The name of the HTML attribute for the element

value.description: The value of the HTML attribute for the element

left.description: The amount of pixels from the left of the page

top.description: The amount of pixels from the top of the page

selector.description: The DOM selector of the element

debug.description: When debugOpts options are present, results are here

console.description: A list of console messages from the browser

cookies.description: List of cookies for the site or null

html.description: The HTML string of the website or null

screenshot.description: A base64-encoded string of the site or null

expires.description:
Cookie expiration date as the number of seconds since the UNIX epoch. Set to `-1` for
session cookies

session.description: True in case of session cookie.

priority.description: Cookie Priority. Supported only in Chrome.

sameParty.description: True if cookie is SameParty. Supported only in Chrome.

sourceScheme.description: Cookie source scheme type. Supported only in Chrome.

partitionKey.description:
Cookie partition key. In Chrome, it is the top-level site the
partitioned cookie is available in. In Firefox, it matches the
source origin
(https://w3c.github.io/webdriver-bidi/#type-storage-PartitionKey).

partitionKeyOpaque.description: True if cookie partition key is opaque. Supported only in Chrome.

401.description: The request is missing, or contains bad, authorization credentials.

408.description: The request took has taken too long to process.

429.description: Too many requests are currently being processed.

500.description: An internal error occurred when handling the request.

post.description:
A JSON-based API for getting a screenshot binary from either a supplied
"url" or "html" payload in your request. Many options exist including
cookies, user-agents, setting timers and network mocks.

schema.description:
Whether or nor to load ad-blocking extensions for the session.
This currently uses uBlock Origin and may cause certain sites
to not load properly.

Launch options, which can be either an object
of puppeteer.launch options or playwright.launchServer
options, depending on the API. Must be either JSON
object, or a base64-encoded JSON object.

Override the system-level timeout for this request.
Accepts a value in milliseconds.
The authorization token

fn.description: The function, or statement, to be evaluated in browser context

polling.description:
An interval at which the pageFunction is executed, defaults to raf.
If polling is a number, then it is treated as an interval in milliseconds
at which the function would be executed. If polling is a string,
then it can be one of the following values: "raf" or "mutation"

timeout.description:
Maximum time to wait for in milliseconds. Defaults to 30000 (30 seconds).
Pass 0 to disable timeout.

200.description:
Response can either be a text/plain base64 encoded body
or a binary stream with png/jpeg as a content-type

401.description: The request is missing, or contains bad, authorization credentials.

get.description:
Connect to an already-running Chromium process with a library like
puppeteer, or others, that work over chrome-devtools-protocol. Chromium
must already be launched in order to not return a 404.

get.description:
Connect to an existing page in Chromium with a library like
chrome-remote-interface or others that work the page websocketDebugger
URL. You can get this unique URL by calling the /json/list API
or by finding the page's unique ID from your library of choice.

post.description: A JSON-based API. Given a "url" or "html" field, runs and returns HTML content after the page has loaded and JavaScript has parsed.

schema.description:
Whether or nor to load ad-blocking extensions for the session.

to not load properly.

items.description:
An array of patterns (using `req.url().match(r.pattern)` to match) and their

pattern.description:

corresponding responses to use in order to fulfill those requests.

setJavaScriptEnabled.description: Whether or not to allow JavaScript to run on the page.

fn.description: The function, or statement, to be evaluated in browser context

polling.description:
An interval at which the pageFunction is executed, defaults to raf.
If polling is a number, then it is treated as an interval in milliseconds
at which the function would be executed. If polling is a string,
then it can be one of the following values: "raf" or "mutation"

schema.description:
An HTML payload of the website or HTML after JavaScript
parsing and execution.

200.description:
An HTML payload of the website or HTML after JavaScript
parsing and execution.

400.description: The request contains errors or didn't properly encode content.

401.description: The request is missing, or contains bad, authorization credentials.

408.description: The request took has taken too long to process.

429.description: Too many requests are currently being processed.

500.description: An internal error occurred when handling the request.

post.description:
A JSON or JavaScript content-type API for returning files Chrome has downloaded during
the execution of puppeteer code, which is ran inside context of the browser.
Browserless sets up a blank page, a fresh download directory, injects your puppeteer code, and then executes it.
You can load external libraries via the "import" syntax, and import ESM-style modules
that are written for execution inside of the browser. Once your script is finished, any
downloaded files from Chromium are returned back with the appropriate content-type header.

schema.description:
Whether or nor to load ad-blocking extensions for the session.
This currently uses uBlock Origin and may cause certain sites
to not load properly.

Launch options, which can be either an object
of puppeteer.launch options or playwright.launchServer
options, depending on the API. Must be either JSON
object, or a base64-encoded JSON object.

Override the system-level timeout for this request.
Accepts a value in milliseconds.
The authorization token

Responses are determined by the returned value of the downloads
themselves, so there isn't a static response type for this API.

200.description:
Responses are determined by the returned value of the downloads
themselves, so there isn't a static response type for this API.

400.description: The request contains errors or didn't properly encode content.

401.description: The request is missing, or contains bad, authorization credentials.

408.description: The request took has taken too long to process.

429.description: Too many requests are currently being processed.

500.description: An internal error occurred when handling the request.

post.description:
A JSON or JavaScript content-type API for running puppeteer code in the browser's context.
Browserless sets up a blank page, injects your puppeteer code, and runs it.
You can optionally load external libraries via the "import" module that are meant for browser usage.
Values returned from the function are checked and an appropriate content-type and response is sent back
to your HTTP call.

schema.description:
Whether or nor to load ad-blocking extensions for the session.
This currently uses uBlock Origin and may cause certain sites
to not load properly.

Launch options, which can be either an object
of puppeteer.launch options or playwright.launchServer
options, depending on the API. Must be either JSON
object, or a base64-encoded JSON object.

Override the system-level timeout for this request.
Accepts a value in milliseconds.
The authorization token

Responses are determined by the returned value of the function
itself. Binary responses (PDF's, screenshots) are returned back
as binary data, and primitive JavaScript values are returned back
by type (HTML data is "text/html", Objects are "application/json")

200.description:
Responses are determined by the returned value of the function
itself. Binary responses (PDF's, screenshots) are returned back
as binary data, and primitive JavaScript values are returned back
by type (HTML data is "text/html", Objects are "application/json")

400.description: The request contains errors or didn't properly encode content.

401.description: The request is missing, or contains bad, authorization credentials.

408.description: The request took has taken too long to process.

429.description: Too many requests are currently being processed.

500.description: An internal error occurred when handling the request.
